icap.justification: It teaches TDD by first having a failing test, then gets you to fix the code to make the test pass and finally you need to refactor working code to make it more concise.  All real-world software development tasks.

meaningful_artifact.justification: Writing a unit test from reading a spec.  Fixing a bug.  Refactoring code.

learning_through_building.justification: Focuses on the core goals, no frills, understanding the concepts necessary to write code and tests.

heuristics.comments: The example assert syntax was provided in the first test but not in tests 2 and 3.  I got an error on arr.filter not existing in Chrome.

E1_conceptual_fidelity.justification: Clear and simple instructions, focusing on the three stages of TDD.

E2_process_replicability.justification: The tool is very config-driven and looks easy to repurpose.

open_ended.most_positive: It's a simple but useful tool that is fun to use.
open_ended.most_negative: Chrome not working with the required version of JavaScript.

icap.justification: You need to understand the code snippet and identify the notation being used.

meaningful_artifact.justification: The graphs were a little tricky, I tried to drag a line the first time.  It would be nice to be able to undo.

learning_through_building.justification: I'm not sure "making" is the right term, but you need to understand code and select the right notation as well as draw the performance graph of that notation.

heuristics.comments: Can't undo a click, either a button for O notation or clicking the graph.

E1_conceptual_fidelity.justification: Forces the user to understand the implications of simple algorithms and a very exciting algo race too!

E2_process_replicability.justification: The tool is easy to understand the various screens and is config-driven.

open_ended.most_positive: Matching code snippets to O notation is a very useful skill.

icap.justification: Forces you to think how SQL Injection works and what techniques are commonly used.

meaningful_artifact.justification: A working snippet that demonstrates the weakness with some extra goals thrown in beyond the basics.

learning_through_building.justification: You need to understand the weakness and exploit it.

heuristics.comments: It isn't *too* helpful to the users, which is a good thing - it forces you to think.

E1_conceptual_fidelity.justification: It shows common security holes and how to exploit them (and therefore why they're bad and how to avoid them).

E2_process_replicability.justification: Another template/config driven app with a clear sturucture.

open_ended.most_positive: The exploits were fun and interesting.

icap.justification: A really nice tool, the best so far.  Shows you the desired layout and the property to use to match the example.

meaningful_artifact.justification: CSS is notoriously tricky, covers some core tweaks to organise a UI.

learning_through_building.justification: User is presented with the property and they must use the correct value to get the desired layout.

heuristics.comments: A nice tool that is easy to use, updates instantly and is very clear what the objective is and how you are doing.

E1_conceptual_fidelity.justification: Teaches core concepts of layout with simple examples.

E2_process_replicability.justification: Another config-driven app that is well structured.

open_ended.most_positive: It's very well put together, everything is laid out simply and is very easy to understand what is going on.

icap.justification: Instant output of matches as you type allowing you to fine-tune your pattern.

meaningful_artifact.justification: The patterns get complex and are useful for real world situations.

learning_through_building.justification: Results on the fly show instant results of your actions.

heuristics.comments: The "Identifier" pattern wasn't clear what I was looking for, and for operator I ended up wtih all operators but it said I had 1 extra.

E1_conceptual_fidelity.justification: Itis purely about a regex to parse text and sticks to the core.

E2_process_replicability.justification: Another config-driven and well structured app.

open_ended.most_positive: Gives hints as to how to parse text and is easy to use.
open_ended.most_negative: Some text on the exact purpose of the exercise would help in a couple of sections.
